name: Navy Field 2 : Conqueror of the Ocean
description: Navy Field 2 is the follow up to Navy Field, the original pioneer of Massively Multiplayer Strategic Online Naval Warfare. Cooperate with your team to maximize the potential of your vessel as you face off in large-scale naval battles. Challenge yourself to become the ultimate captain!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7, or 8 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Onboard DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7, or 8 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Discrete DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 4 GB available space

reviews.review_text: What could have been a good game, has turned into a piece of garbage. It is deffinatly a PAY TO WIN game, that non wallet warriors have little chance of success. It seems like it is following every other cash grab games plan.  The game play is interesting enough, but the science fiction that it incorporates is VERY dissapointing...I still cant get over how games can scew up HISTORY....This one is no different......a few examples.  1. teleporting of ships....REALLY??? 2. Desrtoyers (wallet warrior) that can take 8 Long lance torpedo hits (most Destroyers could not survive 1 LOL) 3. Landing Craft that can outrun a Light Cruiser with armor to rival a Cruiser (they look like PT boats they are so fast)  Then we can get into the downtime of the game as of late...not good, with them changing their minds like their underwear on issues they are trying to 'fix'....ends up WORSE!  I gave it 3 weeks of play before writing this review to be fair....Just fyi.  I had really hoped for it to be better.
Go play World of Warships.

Do not bother with this game it becomes a match of hide in the dark and shoot quickly. You can never have fun because of this and its extremely unrealistic and unbalanced. It makes carriers the number 1 ship because of this.

The game as a MMO offers good team-working gameplay.  As a historical simulation game set in certain period of our history it excellently simulates 2WW-Era naval battles,  giving real difference among certain ship classes and their role in battle.  There are ofc real cash paid items, as in every freemium games, but they are giving you only a slight advantage. What matters the most is  player skills  - both tactical, and manual. This scecond plays the bigest role, when you decide  to use - in my opinion the best feature of the game - manual keyboard ship gun aiming control. (in WW2 there were none point&click aiming systems!)  The game has some disadvantages, nothing and nobody is perfect, but the devs had shown, that they are really listening the community, making changes that goes straight along players wishes.

If you liked Navy Field 1 you will probably like this.  End of the day its a pretty fun game and its free so your really not losing much to try it out. I think as long as you enjoy things like world of tanks / war thunder then you will probably enjoy it. If you hate those games still give it a go unless you have download limits your just losing your time if you hate it.

This is quite a game suitable for almost all computers and players, not much violence, just blasting the crap out of ships, with no blood just explosions, so it's not that violent for younger kids to play. Pros: This game is free, so people with financial problems can still play, You don't need alot of performance, the people with financial problems might have a poor performance laptop or computer, but this game doesn't really need much disk space or performance to run smoothly This game is so fun, it is really fun for everyone,  Cons: Graphics not the best ( Well that's good for people with poor PCs) Notes: So this game is really fun as I mentioned, You just pick your country, buy ships, pick lines, unlock and it gets really interesting and addicting.
any game that offers you the chance to play/use a Yamato is a great game :D
The producer of this game has no sincerity. BAD game experience.

Unlike most poeple that tink this is a bad game i wont to say that this game is very fun and frustating at the same time. Whit that i don't want to say that the game is bad but is what make the difference in this game, bacause you can lose just as like you can win. To win a game is necessary cooperation and strategy (you just need to stik together and try to focus the same target) whit those you will see how the game become more fun and awsome to play. For the ship i have to admit two tings:  1) At the start you will tink is easy to progress from ship to ship, because you can obtain Tier III ship very quick but then you will see how hard is to get all the other ship in the game and because of that you have to chose what class ship you whant in the game like; i take the submarine or i will take a battleship.  2) The machmaking isn't fair but you can still win a battle by working together, like a have said frist you just need to stik together and try to focus the same target, that is the key to win in this game and the game mechanic are make to let you tink what are you doing insted of run to the enemy whit the bigger gun (some torpedo and you will be dead soon)  The last tingh i want to say is this THE GAME IS NOT PAY TO WIN! and trust me a have play a lot of game (not on steam) saing the same tingh but in the end the pay to win was there, but not here and not in this game if you get killed by the most biggest ship in the game is the machmaking foult and not a pay to win player.  In the game is possible to unlock evryting whit patience and good skill

The game isnt that bad, they could have done much better though. Many NF veteran rather play the old NF over this, i do like them both, but it seem alittle off with realism and balance. Here you have women on board, so many torpedoes for small ships, there no telling what will happen with women on board that sailors (men) get distracted and sank the boat itself.

First - Navy Field 2 feels nice to me.   Different types of ships = different gameplay.  Team based and team dependant.  Simply enough controls, low system reqirements. I can really recommend to try it, despite of enormous flaws.   Important: I am playing this game with non-Steam account, and I've played it a year ago (Nexon published). So dont get confused with 0 playtime.   Second - I cant recommend this game. Well, seriously - I cant.  There is Pay-to-grind-less - yes.    There is Pay-to-WIN - no, but close to, because premium officers have better stats, premium equipment have double stats (+5% accuracy - normal, +10% accuracy - premium one) - so Visa can give you an edge in fight, and quite a sharp one.    Team based and team dependant - because matchmaking sometimes throws crasy setups in battle (maybe because of low player base).  No information about game mechanics given, players have to figure out everything themselves - and it's costly.  Nice but primitive visuals.  Still bugs in game.  Far from optimal interface (IMO).  Steam account integration problems. Even PROBLEMS.  Good game to play for fun. But if you want to max your odds, to get all the advantages - you have to pay. Constantly. So - not recommended for serious players.
blow stuff up, earn money + exp! very fun WW2 ship battle game the ship variety is huge with nice detail and lots of unqiueness to each ship, fuels my inner history nerd 8-)

I like this game a lot!  It's quite simple as it stands. I used to play NF1, which was much more complex. That said, it's clear that several features are still being worked on in NF2 and will be released at a later time.  Also, the ducumenation, tutorials, and tool tips suck in this game currently. No hard stats are available anywhere, and I'm still finding out new features that exist by reading the forums, etc. This stuff should be explained in-game clearly. It's not even clear is some features are active or not.  I am having fun playing this game and I hope to see it evolve to be even better than NF1!
wont let me log in with the correct log in

It's not a bad game another take on a MOBA game. The challenge ramps up quick with the game, and with the other players. Remember this is a free to play game. So If want to stick with the game you will be throwing a couple of dollars like any of the others.

It is a better game then people give it credit for. I find it fun. Battles are generally quick and furious. The tech trees are not overly hard for grinding until you get to the very top tiers.   Unlike many games in this genre, it is easy to play and hard to master. Skill is rewarded, and the learning curve is not nearly as bad as other games I have played.

Terrible. Just, terrible.
Go Steel Ocean , much better :)
Game is very user unfriendly. Take the old navy field, throw out what was good about it, and you have Navy Field 2.

Hmm...not really a polite way to put this. NF2, I am disappointed. I spent 100s of hours, and $100's of $$$ on the Original Navyfield. Frankly, the original took me by surprise. As a hardcore 1st person pov simulator fan, I would not even have given Navyfield a chance had I not been invited by some AA clan buddies. Once I started, I could'nt stop. It amazed me how such a graphically simple, top down view game could put its hooks into me so successfully. So of course after having discovered there was a Navyfield 2, and on Steam (which I now have embraced), I could not download it fast enough. My first thoughts are here in list format:  - Why can't I skip this damn tutorial? - Did I download the wrong game? - Why is the background music so friggen loud and why cant I change it? Oh yeah, forced into tutorial! - Yay! Done with tutorial... what about recruiting an aide? How? Oh does it cost money? Can tell, oh well, skip it - Into battle.... did I hit a time acceleration button somewhere? - Why do the graphics look just like Navyfield I ? - Why are the ships turning around like go karts flying around a track?  And lastely...   - Where did I put that Navyfiled I installer again... I hope all my old premium stuff I paid so much money for is still there!!  - Navyfield II first experience compelled me to stop playing, not continue and as a Veteran to the franchise left me with a strong sense of disappointment. Like when Disney bought Lucas franchise.  If your new to NF, this might not seem to bad, but if you are not new... you will be asking yourself, why in the world would I want to play this?
Guys srly this game is not like world of warship and why are you judging 2 differnt games when there not suppose to be the same.

As pretty much the only submarine player on the Washington server, its heavily weighed against you. Maps are huge, barely any time to stay underwater, torpedoes barely damage anyone who buys bulge armor, completely vulnerable at periscope depth to pretty much every surface vessel, not to mention no snorkels so even at periscope depth, you're losing oxygen. Not to mention there is either a hack or a bug that lets capital ships without having or using sonar to track you at depth below periscope depth accurately. There is also a bug where the sub randomly does not have to surface pretty much indefinitely. Pretty much any stealth advantage is sometimes flat out negated. Not to mention, sonar doesn't work both ways in game, i.e., I as a submarine cant use sonar to detect surface targets, especially since your surface field of view becomes almost as small as your ship at depths deeper than 3.   Pros: its visually pleasing, and the nationalities speaking their mother tongues is a cool touch.  Cons: It's neither as fun nor playable as NF1 (which is still online, mind you), and it's still somewhat buggy.  I'm still going to recommend it because maybe if more people actually played, there'd me a more active following by the devs.

OMG this game is so much fun, its like you drive ship in the ocean and shoot other ships. Sometimes other ships shoot you so you hide behind ships. Its like playing a giant game of dodge ball in the ocean using a floating ball.
not recommended to play this game, world of warships so much better than this game

A faily decent game, except for the fact that it has the most unbalanced matchmaking I've ever seen. Its like BB guns vs nukes or like a cippled midget vs the Hulk whens he's super ♥♥♥♥♥♥. If they would fix that aspect it would be a lot more fun. 6/10

46 hours in, and for the most part the game is fun. Big differences between this version and NF1:  1. No Gun options, what it comes with is what you get. Most ships you can upgrade the guns for more damage, better accuracy, and faster reload, but it feels to be a major 'miss' when compared to NF1's modifications.  2. No Premium Ships currently. This is good and bad at the same time, as in NF1's premium ships were by no means a 'pay to win' option, but if you got good with them they did help you grind a bit faster.  3. Manual aiming is a huge pain in the A. Not sure if it's the quicker speed of the game (all ships feel like they are moving at lightspeed in comparison) and manual aiming is too slow. Combine that with any amount of lagging at all, and you end up with a big loss. I only ever used auto aim for a few cl's and ca's in NF1, but in this version I haven't managed over 20K damage with manual aim mode. Maybe it's better with bigger boats, but I'm kinda doubting it.  4. Lag, lock-ups, and another loss. Any time you 'Retreat' or have to Quit the game due to your game lagging out and then freezing, the game counts that battle in your win/loss record as a loss. Not a big deal if you don't care, but NF1 a lot of us prided ourselves in having a 60-75% Win ratio. Not possible to maintain that with 5-10 auto losses in a 4 hour sitting due to servers gumming up. And it's not player's computer, as it seems to be affecting everyone equally, no matter system specs.  All in all, the game is fun. But with the many issues, frustrations, and annoyances, it's just not worth putting any money into the game. Give it a go maybe if you have some time to kill, but I would give this title a pass.

And most important and gamebreaking: Matchmaking is terrible, it creates very unbalanced battles - a lot, It also matches low tiers with much higher tiers, which just leads to more frustration when your teammates are being destroyed one after another and you can hardly do a thing.

Game's much better than the user review suggests; maybe the review has to do with the company we all hate? But really, most of the negative things mentioned in the reviews don't seem to be that bad.  There's ZERO chance the grind is worse than World of Tanks or any other games. Unlike WOT, even if the round is lost, you get quite a bit of award according to your performance / dmg. done. You can leave the game once you're sunk, and there is NO WAITING time until the round is over; you can start another game as soon as you are back in lobby. The game's actually great; give it a try guys. I surely was doubtful at first, but I am loving it.
this is not the game i hoped for it has that naval fell butt its top doun veiw makes it hard for players like me.

This is a game I wanted to like. I really loved NF1 played it forever and liked it for its uniqueness.  Now the genre isn't quiet so empty, here we have NF2, World of Warships is coming out, and presumably more are to come.  NF2 to me felt like a dumbed down, simpler, and easier NF1. Its exactly what I didn't want. I would have been thrilled at the prospect of a modeled and rebalanced NF1. Instead we got rid of manual aiming and everything is now auto-aim to some degree which really removed a great amount of player skill from the game.  They just really missed the mark in my opinion, a large part of what made NF1 great even for people not a fan of ships was the interesting and skill oriented aiming system by removing this they effectively removed the main skill from the game.   It feels more like an easy cash farmer now, the sort of f2p program shoved out to make a dime not be a great game. So its with a great amount of disappointment I'll say I can't recommend this game.
Loved the game, simple easy to use controls and fast paced gameplay.
Pretty good game,long grinds to get more ships but some good fun.
Just a waste of time.

Great game for a great price. They have made improvements since the first game including capture points on islands. This gives the 'flagship' unique abilities sure as scout planes, bombers, and radar ship detection. Definately worth a try if you are on the fence about it!

As a former player of the original Navyfield, I do not recommend this. The excessive amount of pay2win content will make any fight against paying players a suicide. It is not uncommon to see half of your team reaped by these players.  The graphics will let you down as well, not to mention the high usage of computer resources to achieve them.  If you want a strategic naval combat game, stick to the original Navyfield.
Worse game ever produced.

I recommended this game because i love battleships and NF2 runs perfectly on my laptop. While NF2 have lots of bad reviews but i really do enjoy how you can just jump in and have a quick battle anytime you want, and the variety of ships is plenty for me to choose from and suit my own battle style. but the biggest dissapointment for me has to be ship upgrades. I dont mean the overall 'tech tree' upgrade, i mean single ship upgrades. Because the stats upgrades just feels very or almost no effect on your ship. Apart from a few ship can have different main battery upgrades, otherwise the upgrades most of the time gives you less than 5% improvements. I know this is acurate and balanced since you cant just upgrade a tier1 ship that grants tier 5 ships abilities, but still... i still think the upgrades could be done better by giving more options on types of guns to equipt or upgrades to grant ships additional firepower.  Forexample the myoko or tone is known to have torpedos, maybe add torpedos to them will be a better upgrade compare to like 0.03% faster reload or 0.1% more firepower... Anyway i'd say im gonna have at least another 100 hours on this game, but if nothing changes after that, is verylikely ill get bored and quit like many others has
